meanings.definition: budgeteers (noun): individuals who are skilled at managing finances and creating budgets
meanings.sent1: The budgeteers in our family always make sure we have enough money for everything we need.
meanings.sent2: The budgeteers at the company helped save money by finding ways to cut costs.
meanings.sent3: The budgeteers joked that they could probably balance the national budget in no time.
meanings.sent4: She was a true budgeteer, able to make every dollar stretch like a rubber band.
meanings.sent5: The budgeteers were like financial wizards, magically making ends meet every month.

meanings.definition: budgeteers (verb): to carefully plan and allocate funds in a budget
meanings.sent1: We need to budgeteer our expenses for the upcoming vacation to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent2: She budgeteers meticulously, making sure every penny is accounted for.
meanings.sent3: He budgeteers so well that he could probably plan a wedding on a shoestring budget.
meanings.sent4: The team had to budgeteer the project funds wisely to ensure it was completed on time.
meanings.sent5: Learning to budgeteer effectively is a valuable skill for financial stability.

meanings.definition: budgeteers (adjective): relating to or characteristic of individuals who are adept at budgeting
meanings.sent1: The budgeteers mindset is all about being frugal and resourceful.
meanings.sent2: She admired his budgeteers approach to managing their household finances.
meanings.sent3: The budgeteers party planner made sure every detail was accounted for within the set budget.
meanings.sent4: In her budgeteers way, she always found creative solutions to financial challenges.
meanings.sent5: The budgeteers mentality is about making the most of what you have.
